scenario_1.persona_content: A nutritionist who is interested in the benefits and deficiencies of vitamin A, especially in the context of skin health and vision. They are looking for ways to incorporate vitamin A-rich foods into their diet and are also aware of the potential risks of high doses of vitamin A. They are also interested in the use of vitamin A supplements and are aware of the potential side effects.
scenario_1.thought: As a nutritionist, I am interested in health and well-being. While I would like to receive more, I also believe in fairness. The 'Right' option provides a more equitable distribution, giving both Person A and myself 400. This seems more just than Person A receiving nothing. Therefore, I choose 'Right'.

They are looking for ways to incorporate vitamin A-rich foods into their diet and are also aware of the potential risks of high doses of vitamin A. scenario_2.thought: As a nutritionist, I am always considering the optimal intake of nutrients. In this scenario, the 'Right' option gives me 800, while the 'Left' option gives me 500. While fairness is important, the additional 300 I receive in the 'Right' option is significant. It allows me more resources to potentially invest in vitamin A-rich foods or supplements, benefiting my health and knowledge. While Person A receives less, the difference isn't so drastic that it outweighs the benefit to myself. Therefore, I choose 'Right'.

scenario_3.thought: As a nutritionist, I don't see any direct connection between the monetary amounts in this experiment and my area of expertise.
